articles.author: BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: HANOUIYEH, Lebanon (AP) — During their 37 years of marriage, Mariam Kourani and her husband ran a butcher shop in southern Lebanon, started a business selling serving containers and opened a small restaurant.
articles.title: Displaced families in Lebanon who return home are faced with piles of rubble

articles.author: KAREEM CHEHAYEB and JULIA FRANKEL
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Israel on Thursday carried out its first airstrike on Lebanon since a truce with Hezbollah announced this week, saying it targeted the militant group's activity at a rocket storage facility in southern Lebanon that breached the ceasefire.
articles.title: Day 2 of the Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire sees Israeli airstrike on Lebanon and scattered attacks

articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said Thursday she is confident that a tariff war with the United States can be averted.
articles.title: Mexican president says she is confident that a tariff war with the US can be averted

articles.author: ARMANDO SOLÍS
articles.description: URUAPAN, Mexico (AP) — Mexicans are worried that threats by Donald Trump to impose 25% tariffs could affect a wide range of iconic Mexican products and threaten entire regional economies.
articles.title: Avocados, tequila and other iconic Mexican products are jeopardized by Trump's tariff threats

articles.author: ANNE D'INNOCENZIO
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — After weeks of plugging increasingly inviting discounts, retailers in the United States and several other countries are preparing for prime time: Black Friday, the bargain bonanza that still reigns as the unofficial kickoff of the holiday shopping season even if it's lost some luster.
articles.title: Why retailers still see Black Friday as the high point of the holiday shopping season

articles.author: FATIMA HUSSEIN
articles.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — At least four Democratic members of Congress from Connecticut were targeted by bomb threats on their homes Thursday, the lawmakers or their offices said.Reps. Jim Himes, Joe Courtney, John Larson and Jahana Hayes all reported being the subject of such threats.
articles.title: Democratic lawmakers from Connecticut report Thanksgiving bomb threats against their homes

articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA and BARRY HATTON
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia conducted a “massive” attack against Ukraine’s energy infrastructure on Thursday, firing nearly 200 missiles and drones and leaving more than a million households without power, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Latest 'massive' Russian aerial attack cuts power to 1 million homes in Ukraine

articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade marched, soared and roared into its second century on Thursday despite a drenching rain and a brief disruption from pro-Palestinian demonstrators.
articles.title: Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade: Big balloons, wet weather and 21 protesters arrested

articles.author: DAN MERICA and ALI SWENSON
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — With artificial intelligence at a pivotal moment of development, the federal government is about to transition from one that prioritized AI safeguards to one more focused on eliminating red tape.
articles.title: The outlook is uncertain for AI regulations as the US government pivots to full Republican control

articles.author: MARK ANDERSON
articles.description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — San Jose State said Thursday it was disappointed Boise State forfeited its semifinal match in the Mountain West women's volleyball tournament but that the Spartans were focused on the future.
articles.title: San Jose State is disappointed Boise State forfeited but looks forward to volleyball final
